TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ConfigurationPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: Provides a permission structure that allows methods or classes to access configuration files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ConfigurationPermission class provides a permission structure that allows methods or classes to access configuration files. Also, ConfigurationPermission provides ways to resolve multiple permissions values through such methods as <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPermission.Union%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPermission.Intersect%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although the method signature accepts any object that implements the <xref:System.Security.IPermission> interface, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception will be thrown if calling the <xref:System.Object.GetType%2A> method on the object referenced by the `target` parameter does not return <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPermission?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.summary: Compares the object with an object implementing the interface.
Docs.returns: if the permission state is equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the method signature accepts any object that implements the <xref:System.Security.IPermission> interface, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception will be thrown if calling the <xref:System.Object.GetType%2A> method on the object referenced by the `target` parameter does not return <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPermission?displayProperty=fullName>.
If the object referenced by the `target` parameter is `null`, the comparison is done between the permission state of the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPermission> object and the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> value of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> enumeration.
